groups.name: Things You Wear on Your Feet

easy.notes: Easy category explanations: Bright Things groups common sources of light; Things You Sit On are everyday seating options; Things You Wear on Your Feet are common footwear; Kitchen Helpers lists basic utensils. Near-miss temptation avoided by keeping each item clearly in its group.

medium.notes: Medium explanations: Word Fragments hints at words that can stand with others to form phrases (play-ground, sound-outdoor is a near miss but not a standard compound). Prefix Partners show common word pairs with shared prefixes that alter meaning. Cute Compounds are familiar compound words. Hidden Shape items are ordinary objects that also evoke a simple shape idea (pillow: roundish, plate: round). Near-miss temptation was avoided by ensuring no item could fit two groups convincingly; e.g., 'sunflower' is clearly a compound, not a single fragment in Word Fragments.

hard.notes: Hard explanations: Abstract Roles groups people by professions that imply certain tasks (not literal actions). Opposite Pairs uses clear opposites for thinking; Rhythm Makers involve music-related terms. Tiny Tools lists small handy items used in desks or classrooms. Near-miss temptation avoided by ensuring similar-sounding or related terms do not cross groups (e.g., tempo vs rhythm are related but grouped together only in Rhythm Makers; no item fits another group's core idea).
